metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7813 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Inside the JavaScript parser, a cast of an integer to a narrower type can result in data read from outside the buffer being parsed. This usually results in a non-exploitable crash, but can leak a limited amount of information from memory if it matches JavaScript identifier syntax. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 56.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-7813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '56.0+build6-0ubuntu1').
